reasoning: D-Glyceric aciduria is an extremely rare autosomal recessive metabolic disorder caused by D-glycerate kinase (glycerate 2-kinase) deficiency. Prevalence is unknown according to Orphanet and NIH rare disease databases. Only scattered case reports exist in medical literature. Characterized by abnormal urinary excretion of D-glyceric acid with highly variable phenotype ranging from severe encephalopathy with seizures to mild intellectual delay or normal development. Insufficient epidemiological data for incidence estimation.
